unnormalised: New Delhi: In a ceremony held yesterday, Ms. Aisha Khan was awarded the "Social Worker of the Year" award by the Delhi Government for her tireless efforts in promoting education among underprivileged children. The event, attended by prominent figures including Dr. Rajiv Kumar, Principal of Delhi Public School, recognized Ms. Khan's dedication to her NGO, "Umeed Foundation."
normalised: New Delhi: In a ceremony held yesterday, Ms. Aisha Khan was awarded the "Social Worker of the Year" award by the Delhi Government for her tireless efforts in promoting education among underprivileged children. The event, attended by prominent figures including Doctor Rajiv Kumar, Principal of Delhi Public School, recognized Ms. Khan's dedication to her N-G-O, "Umeed Foundation."

unnormalised: According to a press release issued by the government, Ms. Khan’s work has impacted over 5000 children across the city. She has also been instrumental in raising funds amounting to Rs. 50 lakh for educational resources and infrastructure development. Her efforts have been lauded by community leaders and residents alike.
normalised: According to a press release issued by the government, Ms. Khan’s work has impacted over five thousand children across the city. She has also been instrumental in raising funds amounting to rupee fifty lakh for educational resources and infrastructure development. Her efforts have been lauded by community leaders and residents alike.

unnormalised: "Ms. Khan's unwavering commitment to the cause of education is truly inspiring," said Mr. Sunil Verma, a local councilor who attended the event. "Her work serves as a reminder of the importance of compassion and social responsibility." Numerous students and parents whose lives have been touched by Ms. Khan's work were present at the ceremony.
normalised: "Ms. Khan's unwavering commitment to the cause of education is truly inspiring," said Mr. Sunil Verma, a local councilor who attended the event. "Her work serves as a reminder of the importance of compassion and social responsibility." Numerous students and parents whose lives have been touched by Ms. Khan's work were present at the ceremony.

unnormalised: The award, which includes a cash prize of Rs. 1 lakh and a citation, was presented by the Chief Minister of Delhi. The government has also pledged to support Ms. Khan’s future initiatives through various grants and collaborative programs. The event concluded with a vote of thanks delivered by Mr. Prakash Sharma, Secretary of the Department of Social Welfare.
normalised: The award, which includes a cash prize of rupee one lakh and a citation, was presented by the Chief Minister of Delhi. The government has also pledged to support Ms. Khan’s future initiatives through various grants and collaborative programs. The event concluded with a vote of thanks delivered by Mr. Prakash Sharma, Secretary of the Department of Social Welfare.
